purpleculture_pinyin:
qiào
to stick up; to rise on one end; to tilt
заступиться; встать на один конец; Наклонять

qiáo
outstanding; to raise
выдающийся; поднять
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 翘)
Pictophonetic: 堯 indicates the sound; 羽 (wings) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
翹尾巴 [ qiào wěi ba ]: to be cocky
翹辮子 [ qiào biàn zi ]: (coll.) to die; to kick the bucket
翹板 [ qiào bǎn ]: a see-saw
翹翹板 [ qiào qiào bǎn ]: see-saw; also written 跷跷板
翹舌音 [ qiào shé yīn ]: retroflex sound (e.g. in Mandarin zh, ch, sh, r)
翹首 [ qiáo shǒu ]: to raise one's head and look
翹楚 [ qiáo chǔ ]: person of outstanding talent
翹首以待 [ qiáo shǒu yǐ dài ]: to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom); to anxiously await
翹望 [ qiáo wàng ]: to raise one's head and look into the distance; fig. to forward to; to long for

heisig_chinese_memo: King Yao likes to turn upward his head so he can see the birds in the sky flapping their wings. &nbsp
Ru_trainchinese:
qiào: (глаг) задирать(ся), поднимать(ся) кверху
qiáo: (графема) поднимать (голову); перекашиваться, коробиться; выдающийся, незаурядный
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A javelin thrower launches it almost hitting a bird, but the bird turn upward one of its wings smoothly avoiding the javelin and only skimming its feather.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " Yu " and " Yao ", the original meaning is the long feather of the bird tail. "Shuowen": "The tail grows hairy. Congyu, Yaosheng." "Songs of the Chu: Calling the Soul": "The room is Cuiqiao, and the Qiong is more beautiful." Wang Yi's Note: "Alice, Yuya."

" Alice " can refer to bird tail. Han Liuxiang's "Nine Sighs-Yuan You": "Shake the feathers and ride the wind and rain."

" Alice " also means lifting. "Zhuangzi‧ Horseshoe": "Looking on the grass to drink water, reaching up to the ground.

" Alice " also expresses inspiration. "Book of Rites‧ Confucianism": "Rough and stubborn, but not in a hurry." Zheng Xuan's note: "Rough, sparse, and subtle. If you don’t know that you have good words and deeds, you will see the matter of color Its intention makes it known." Kong Yingda Shu: "Ask, get up."

" Alice " also refers to disclosure. Song Luo Dajing's "Helin Yulu" Volume Four: "It's so good to talk about people's faults, so this country's warriors can kill them."

" Alice " also means prosperity. "Selected Works‧Lu Ji"Sighing the Death Fu": "Bu Hanlin is sad, and Lingchun is thinking." Li Shan's note: "Alice, lush appearance."

" Alice " can also mean outstanding. Tang Wei Xiyan "Judging People According to the Ground ‧ Right": "It is a job to promote the good and make the best."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " Yu ", " Yao ", the original meaning is the long feather of the bird's tail.
humanum_full_description:
從「羽」，「堯」聲，本義為鳥尾的長羽。《說文》：「尾長毛也。从羽，堯聲。」 《楚辭‧招魂》：「砥室翠翹，絓曲瓊些。」王逸注：「翹，羽也。」

　　「翹」可指鳥尾。漢劉向《九嘆‧遠游》：「搖翹奮羽，馳風騁雨。」

　　「翹」也表示舉起。《莊子‧馬蹄》：「齕草飲水，翹足而陸。」

　　「翹」還表示啟發。《禮記‧儒行》：「麤而翹之，又不急為也。」鄭玄注：「麤，猶疏也，微也。君不知已有善言正行，則觀色緣事而微翹發其意使知之。」孔穎達疏：「翹，起發也。」

　　「翹」亦指揭露。宋羅大經《鶴林玉露》卷四：「好盡言以翹人之過，此國武子所以見殺也。」

　　「翹」還表示茂盛。《文選‧陸機〈嘆逝賦〉》：「步寒林以悽惻，翫春翹而有思。」 李善注：「翹，茂盛貌。」

　　「翹」還可表示突出。唐韋希顏《舉人據地判‧對》：「舉善進賢，英翹是務。」
humanum_short_description: 從「羽」，「堯」聲，本義為鳥尾的長羽。

Chinese: King Yao likes to turn upward his head so he can see the birds in the sky flapping their wings.  
Meaning: turn upward
Hanzi: 翘
Story: A javelin thrower launches it almost hitting a bird, but the bird turn upward one of its wings smoothly avoiding the javelin and only skimming its feather.
Kind: traditional

從「 羽 」，「 堯 」聲，本義為鳥尾的長羽。《說文》：「尾長毛也。从羽，堯聲。」 《楚辭‧招魂》：「砥室翠翹，絓曲瓊些。」王逸注：「翹，羽也。」 「 翹 」可指鳥尾。漢劉向《九嘆‧遠游》：「搖翹奮羽，馳風騁雨。」 「 翹 」也表示舉起。《莊子‧馬蹄》：「齕草飲水，翹足而陸。」 「 翹 」還表示啟發。《禮記‧儒行》：「麤而翹之，又不急為也。」鄭玄注：「麤，猶疏也，微也。君不知已有善言正行，則觀色緣事而微翹發其意使知之。」孔穎達疏：「翹，起發也。」 「 翹 」亦指揭露。宋羅大經《鶴林玉露》卷四：「好盡言以翹人之過，此國武子所以見殺也。」 「 翹 」還表示茂盛。《文選‧陸機〈嘆逝賦〉》：「步寒林以悽惻，翫春翹而有思。」 李善注：「翹，茂盛貌。」 「 翹 」還可表示突出。唐韋希顏《舉人據地判‧對》：「舉善進賢，英翹是務。」
From the sound of " Yu" and " Yao", the original meaning is the long feather of the bird tail. "Shuowen": "The tail grows hairy. Congyu, Yaosheng." "Songs of the Chu: Calling the Soul": "The room is Cuiqiao, and the Qiong is more beautiful." Wang Yi's Note: "Alice, Yuya." " Alice" can refer to bird tail. Han Liuxiang's "Nine Sighs-Yuan You": "Shake the feathers and ride the wind and rain." " Alice" also means lifting. "Zhuangzi‧ Horseshoe": "Looking on the grass to drink water, reaching up to the ground. " Alice" also expresses inspiration. "Book of Rites‧ Confucianism": "Rough and stubborn, but not in a hurry." Zheng Xuan's note: "Rough, sparse, and subtle. If you don’t know that you have good words and deeds, you will see the matter of color Its intention makes it known." Kong Yingda Shu: "Ask, get up." " Alice" also refers to disclosure. Song Luo Dajing's "Helin Yulu" Volume Four: "It's so good to talk about people's faults, so this country's warriors can kill them." " Alice" also means prosperity. "Selected Works‧Lu Ji"Sighing the Death Fu": "Bu Hanlin is sad, and Lingchun is thinking." Li Shan's note: "Alice, lush appearance." " Alice" can also mean outstanding. Tang Wei Xiyan "Judging People According to the Ground ‧ Right": "It is a job to promote the good and make the best."

翹字的基本解释

翹
qiáo

翹
qiào
均见“翘”。

翹字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiáo］
［《廣韻》渠遥切，平宵，羣。］
“翘1”的繁体字。
(1)鸟尾的长羽。
(2)指鸟尾。
(3)举起。
(4)启发。
(5)揭露。
(6)茂盛。
(7)特出；杰出的人才。
(8)高；危。
(9)妇女的一种首饰。
(10)乐器名。
[②]［qiào］
［《廣韻》巨要切，去笑，羣。］
“翘2”的繁体字。
(1)向上昂起。
(2)旧时女子缠足，所穿的鞋头向上翘，因以“翹”指女子的脚。

翹字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【羽字部】　翹； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页959第27
【廣韻】渠遙切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】祁堯切，?音䎗。【說文】尾長毛也。　又【廣雅】舉也。又翹翹，衆也。【類篇】翹翹，高貌。【詩·周南】翹翹錯薪。　又【詩·豳風】予室翹翹。【註】危也。　又【禮·儒行】粗而翹之。【註】微翹發其意。【疏】翹，起發也。　又【左傳·莊二十二年】翹翹車乗。【註】遠貌。　又【后漢輿服志】鸞旗者，編羽旄列繫幢旁，民或謂之雞翹。　又【爾雅·釋草】連，異翹。【疏】連，一名異翹。　又【廣韻】懸也。【類篇】企也。　又【廣韻】巨要切【集韻】祁要切。尾起也。

翹字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
翹字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiáo］
["Guang Yun" Qu Yao cut, flat night, group. ]
The traditional characters of "翘1".
(1) The long feathers of the bird's tail.
(2) Refers to the bird's tail.
(3) Lift up.
(4) Enlightenment.
(5) Disclosure.
(6) Lush.
(7) Outstanding; outstanding talents.
(8) High; dangerous.
(9) A kind of jewelry for women.
(10) The name of the instrument.
[②]［qiào］
["Guangyun" is a big cut, laugh, group. ]
The traditional characters of "翘2".
(1) Lift up.
(2) In the old days, women’s feet were bound, and the toe caps they wore were turned upwards, because “upward” refers to women’s feet.
